titles.title: Danganronpa 3: The End of Kibougamine Gakuen - Zetsubou Hen
ダンガンロンパ3 -The End of 希望ヶ峰学園- 絶望編
Danganronpa 3: The End of Hope`s Peak High School - Despair Arc
단간론파 3 -The End of 키보가미네 학원 - 절망편
弹丸论破3 -The End of 希望之峰学园- 绝望篇

relatedanime.anime: Danganronpa: Kibou no Gakuen to Zetsubou no Koukousei - The Animation

recommendations.recommendation: If you liked the 2013 series watch this to know how it all came to be and the story behind it. If not go watch the 2013 series aka the animation first, if you watch this show first so will you ruin the animation/murder school arc. It is nothing special, not in the same theme as the other arcs of the show and not really anything special. It mainly serves to give a background and deeper understanding to the world, the events of the second arc and builds into understanding the future arc.

If you played trough DR1 and 2, then this anime is pretty much a must-watch. It explains in more details than you`d hoped the backstory of the first two games. Plus in contains a lot of nice Slice of Life with the characters you loved from DR2. Much better than the "Future Side" of DR3 which is a rather poor sequel.

anime.description: Hope`s Peak High School is a special school that nurtures those with exceptional talents and abilities. While only top students are a part of the main course, anyone can join the preparatory course, like http://anidb.net/ch81893 [Hinata Hajime] has. Hinata wants nothing more than to be part of the talented elite, but his desires lead him to a fateful encounter that drives the future of the school into despair. Source: Funimation Note: The first episode received an early screening at a special event held at Toho Cinemas Roppongi Hills Screen 7 on 03.07.2016. The regular TV broadcast started on 14.07.2016.

externalentity.identifier: ダンガンロンパシリーズ

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: game
tag.description: Based on an interactive (even if minimally so) form of entertainment software, generally available for PCs, consoles or arcade machines.

tag.name: visual novel
tag.description: The two terms are similar yet different, however, the fact that they look and `feel` the same outweighs the technical differences. For clarification, visual novels are considered a sub-genre of adventure games and the term does not cover simulations. While the two genres often share a common visual presentation, dating sims are sometimes considered to be more statistically based than the "choose your own adventure" style of visual novels; basically, the choices you make might change something else than just the story arc (or your next porn pic). Dating sims can involve several technical elements such as a time limit, several statistics such as looks and charm which can be boosted through exercise, or an "attraction meter" which can increase or decrease depending on one`s decisions.

tag.name: TV censoring
tag.description: The TV version is censored and later DVD/BD releases are uncensored, so the money-grubbing capitalists can make a couple more bucks at our expense.

tag.name: murder
tag.description: To murder means to bring about someone else`s death, by a voluntary act. Whether it comes from the killer`s own hand or by exposing the victim to life-threatening circumstances, the result is foreseeable and sought by the perpetrator. Someone who murders as their profession/job is an http://anidb.net/t2399 [assassin or hitman].

tag.name: suicide
tag.description: One or several characters in this anime commit suicide.

tag.name: violence censoring
tag.description: Describes TV shows, where parts of the scenes considered as too violent are blackened, blurred, changed to other static screen, or cut out completely. While TV censoring is normally used to boost the BD/DVD sales, this is done under the mantle of being "for the healthy development of youth" or similar excuses. In the long run, it`s just the same. Examples: Deadman Wonderland, Fate/Zero, and Mirai Nikki.

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: death
tag.description: Death is the state of no longer being alive or the process of ceasing to be alive.

character.name: Kirigiri Kyouko
character.description: Kirigiri Kyouko is an enigmatic silver-haired girl whose high school talent is unknown. Though aloof and slow to trust others, she`s adept at noticing things which the other students don`t, which proves vital once bodies start turning up. She often advises Naegi on conducting investigations. Apparently, she`s trying to retrieve something that Monobear stole from her in the past. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Celestia Ludenberck
character.description: Know as Ultimate Gambler. Her real name is Yasuhiro Taeko, as revealed during 3rd trial.

character.name: Ikusaba Mukuro
character.description: Ikusaba Mukuro is the mysterious 16th student.

character.name: Kirigiri Jin
character.description: Kirigiri Jin was the headmaster of Hope`s Peak Academy until he was killed and Monobear took over. Kirigiri Kyouko is his daughter.

character.name: Togami Byakuya
character.description: Super high school-level impostor in guise of http://anidb.net/ch51212 [Togami Byakuya].

character.name: Kamishiro Yuuto
character.description: Kamishiro Yuuto is one of the characters featured in the Danganronpa/Zero novel series. He is the Ultimate Secret Agent and a member of Hope`s Peak Academy`s 77th class.

character.name: Murasame Soushun
character.description: Murasame Soushun is an Ultimate Student Council President. A known predecessor of his title is http://anidb.net/ch83116 [Munakata Kyousuke]. He was the only survivor of The Tragedy of Hope`s Peak Academy, along with http://anidb.net/ch84377 [Izuru]. During the incident, he had sustained a head injury and fell in a comatose-like, unresponsive state.

character.name: Matsuda Yasuke
character.description: Matsuda Yasuke is one of the main characters in the Danganronpa/Zero novel series. Yasuke`s title is Ultimate Neurologist. He is in charge of the Hope`s Peak Academy`s Neurology lab. He is also one of the creators of the Neo World Program alongside http://anidb.net/ch51222 [Fujisaki Chihiro] and Gekkougahara Miaya.

character.name: Nanami Chiaki
character.description: The main heroine of the second game, Chiaki is a sleepy, laid-back student who is inexperienced in the ways of the world, but very skilled at video games. It is learned during the "Graduation" that she is actually an AI program designed to observe and protect the students during the Future Foundation`s experiment.

episode.title: ただいま希望ヶ峰学園
Hello Again, Hope`s Peak High School
Willkommen auf der Hope`s Peak Academy
Tadaima Kibougamine Gakuen
episode.summary: Welcome back to Hope`s Peak High School! Attending class is optional, right? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 狛枝凪斗の憂鬱と驚愕と消失
The Melancholy, Surprise, and Disappearance of Nagito Komaeda
Schicksalhafte Verwechslungen
Komaeda Nagito no Yuuutsu to Kyougaku to Shoushitsu
episode.summary: It`s practical exam time for class 1-B! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 全ての未来にさよならを
A Farewell to All Futures
Die dunkle Seite der Hope`s Peak Academy
Subete no Mirai ni Sayonara o
episode.summary: Hinata finds another Reserve Course student who dreams of joining the Main Course - and who is willing to take drastic measures to get there. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: したごころを君に
My Impurest Heart for You
Mein reinstes Herz für dich
Shita Gokoro o Kimi ni
episode.summary: Chisa Yukizome continues her mission to bring the students in her homeroom class closer together. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 偶然にも最悪な再会
The Worst Reunion by Chance
Ein unerwartetes Wiedersehen
Guuzen ni mo Saiaku na Saikai
episode.summary: Hope`s Peak is plunged into despair after the Student Council`s massacre, and Komaeda tests his luck. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 希望ヶ峰学園史上最大最悪の事件
The Biggest, Most Atrocious Incident in Hope`s Peak High School`s History
Das grösste und scheusslichste Ereignis der Hope`s Peak Academy
Kibougamine Gakuen Shijousaidai Saiaku no Jiken
episode.summary: With Ryota Mitarai as your guide, witness the true power of anime! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 絶望的に運命的な出会い
A Despairfully Fateful Encounter
Eine folgenschwere Begegnung
Zetsubouteki ni Unmeiteki na Deai
episode.summary: Is there any hope for those without talent - or only despair? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 終わりの始まり
Beginning of the End
Der Anfang vom Ende
Owari no Hajimari
episode.summary: Instructor Yukizome returns to her homeroom class after being transferred to the Reserve Course and learns that a lot can change in four months! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: さよなら希望ヶ峰学園
Goodbye, Hope`s Peak High School
Lebe Wohl, Hope`s Peak Academy
Sayonara Kibougamine Gakuen
episode.summary: Hope`s Peak will recite - its death haiku of Despair - for no hope remains. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 君は希望という名の絶望に微笑む
Smile at Despair in the Name of Hope
Tränen der Verzweiflung
Kimi wa Kibou to Iu Na no Zetsubou ni Hohoemu
episode.summary: Betrayal - the ultimate weapon in the game of Despair. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 雪染ちさは笑わない
Chisa Yukizome Doesn`t Smile
Chisa Yukizome lächelt nicht
Yukizome Chisa wa Warawanai
episode.summary: Nanami and Komaeda escape from despair, but can they protect their classmates, or save their teacher? Source: crunchyroll
